thread.title: These are the new destinations Three customers can now visit without roaming charges

author: Rachel Sloper
title: These are the new destinations Three customers can now visit without roaming charges
text:

Mobile network Three has announced that customers will be able to use their phones abroad at no extra cost in a further 11 destinations outside of the EU from today. 
Countries including Chile, Colombia and Costa Rica, plus El Salvador, Guatemala, Nicaragua, Panama, Peru, Uruguay, Vietnam and Mayotte, are now exempt from Three roaming charges, according to the Mirror . 
The news brings the total number of Go Roam destinations to 71. 
Other long haul destinations where Three customers can roam at no extra include USA, Australia, New Zealand and Indonesia. Read More 
It comes after roaming charges were banned across the EU in June - with the law now stating that firms can no longer charge customers extra for using their data allowance in European Union countries. 
The firm said the move was to tackle long haul destinations favoured by Brits. 
Dave Dyson, chief executive at Three, said: "My ambition is to free our customers and offer 100% free roaming worldwide, and we will continue to abolish unfair roaming charges until we achieve this. 
"We’re passionate about improving our customers’ experience when travelling abroad, so they can stay connected and use their phones just as they do at home. To reassure our customers, we have also committed to no changes to roaming on Three following Brexit." All networks were forced to remove roaming charges in the EU in June 2017 following a parliamentary ruling over data usage. 
This includes European Union countries – as well as the European Economic Area countries of Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein - we've a full list of the destinations included through each network here . 
However, the ban does not include calls abroad - so any calls made outside of the UK will incur international - or European - fees. The full list of Feel At Home destinations with Three Spain
